item.title: <wiki> | Using and external disk as a data directory for nextcloud
item.description: This article is not a well though out writeup- rather a dump of what to do when I fuck up again and need to reinstall my nextcloud. I provisioned a 60 GB external hardisk to serve as my data folder in nextcloud. Check if the external device is mounted df -h It isnt check for storage decides: lsblk Now if you find the external disk, it’ll be in /dev, special filesystem that holds a reference to every device attached on your disk

item.title: Mein Browserland #1: The web, cookies, authentication
item.description: The web is a tangled mess; And securing it, no matter what we try, appears to be a hard task, if not impossible. Before talking about HOW to go about securing it, or writing and deploying secure web applications, let’s talk about why the web is a tangled mess. The web, as we know it, is ever-evolving and came about by decades of working on existing features. If a feature was ever released over the web, it was permanent and you could not just get rid of it.
